reviews.text: The train took approx 20 mins. We checked into the Barbizon early (10ish), the very pleasant and helpful receptionist suggested we could upgrade to a delux room and have it straight away for an extra 25e. We took this option, we stayed on the 4th floor with windows overlooking Amsterdam. The room was nothing short of excellent!! Split level with the bathroom and dressing area on the top, stairs down to the lower level with a vvv comfy bed (only gripe is that it was a double not kingsize, but hardly a gripe at all!) The ambience was of a loft conversion with thick beams, very rustic.

Rooms are spacious, clean and well-equipped (exceptionally so). Staff are friendly and courteous, breakfast is excellent and the location couldn't be better - opposite Centraal Station so very easy access from Schiphol Airport. Also very good for the RAI congress centre as a metro stop lies just around the corner whisking you to RAI station in under 15 mins. All-in-all a pleasure to stay in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to Amsterdam for a short break and got a fantastic deal staying at the Barbizon. It is so convenient to Central Station and subsequently the airport. Doesn't look brilliant from teh outside but once in through the doors it is a haven of peace and relaxation. The staff are extremely helpful, effecient and friendly. We checked in fairly quickly and went to our room which was just lovely. Room 129. A standard smoking room, but soo quaint and comfortable. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis and the choice of breakfast was superb. Enough there to set you up for the day. Normally when I travel I go to see the city and sspend little time in the hotel, however this hotel was so comfortable we came home early in the evenings to sit, chat, relax and plan the following day. The hotel is situated well for sightseeing - nowhere is too far away. And Amsterdam and the people of the city make the whole trip a memorable experience.

reviews.text: Wonderful staff and terrific location. Right across the street from the train station. Around the corner from the district. Easy navigation to museums and restaurants. Yes, it is pricey, but totally worth it. Superb breakfasts ($$ but filled us up for most of the day). Concierge and house-keeping staff helpful, friendly, responsive. We had a great room on the top floor with exposed beams and wonderful view of rooftops and church spires, as well as entertaining view of street below. If you don't have to skimp, splurge. After a long day of sightseeing, it was nice to "come home" to the Barbizon.

reviews.text: Absolutely Fantastic Hotel! Having read some of the reviews I was slightly hesitant about going but we found a cheaper internet deal and thought Why Not?! From the outside it does look rather imposing, but the lobby is beautifully decorated and very spacious. The staff were all very courteous and helpful. We were shown to our (inside) room, which was beautifully decorated, very clean with an immaculate bathroom. Safe and plenty of complimentary toiletries, as well as gorgeous bath robes! The mini-bar was the only downside, being EXTORTIONATELY expensive, however there are many shops close-by to bring food/drinks back up to the room. Look out for the charging on the minibar, if you pick an item up for more than 10 seconds it is automatically charged to the room, which I found out to my cost having a look at the items! Apart from that the room was very spacious and well decorated, slightly dusty under the beds but nothing important. The maid service every day was excellent, and all the staff friendly and extremely helpful. The TV didnt have much choice in channels in English, and the movies were slightly expensive, however you dont go to Amsterdam to stay in the room! The rrom itself was quiet, however we did hear some slight door banging to either side, it was not disturbing though. As we had requested a smoking room, this was inside the hotel so we had no outside noise as it looked onto a closed courtyard, not the best view but we were outside a lot of the time anyway. The location is incredible, no long train journeys or walks, and is very close to the red light district. Teh breakfast was inculded in our package and was wonderful. Plenty of choice, hot and cold meats, fish, fruit, cereal, breads, I gather the breakfast was expensive if not booked with the room, however if this is the case there are plenty of cafe's nearby to eat in.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel - Highly Recommended
